intro: Guenthera repanda subsp. diplotaxiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guenthera, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
